Package C2G8_Project

Class Dispatcher

java.lang.Object
C2G8_Project.Dispatcher
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Dispatcher extends Object implements Runnable
The dispatcher is designed to be a component for each program within the system and handles all in and out-bound communications over the DatagramSockets. It implements a custom Publish/Subscribe framework that registers destinations over a network and allows any DispatchConsumers to send and receive messages over the network. Adding Destinations: This should ideally be done prior to starting the Dispatcher after creating it. DispatchConsumer's and Subscriptions: DispatchConsumer Subscribers can receive messages by subscribing to a topic which is a string. Note that topics are not owned by any individual subscriber and multiple DispatchConsumers may be subscribed to the same topic. When a topic has been received a function implemented by DispatchConsumers is called containing the topic and JSON data of the packet. Converting binary data from JSON should be done using the Jackson ObjectMapper. The provided JSON can be converted into the desired type by using the object mapper's readValue(String topic,Class class) method that will return an object of the specified class type T. Do not forget to handle the possibility that data could be corrupted at this point. Read the javadoc for the ObjectMapper for more details. DispatchConsumer's should NOT do any significant work in the DispatchConsumer.receiveDispach function because it will tie down the Dispatcher's execution context during that process. Instead DispatchConsumers should implement the asynchronous processing of messages after converting it so that work happens within another thread's execution context. DispatchConsumers can send messages to the dispatcher and do not need to convert their message. They simply provide the topic that will be used and the data to be sent and it will be automatically converted into JSON and sent via UDP.
Author:
Jayson Mendoza

  • Constructor Details

    • Dispatcher

      public Dispatcher(Destinations destinationIdentifier, String name, int port, int timeOutMills) throws SocketException
      Creates Dispatcher bound to a specific port. The dispatcher does not deal with any errors and passes them on for the class using it to handle.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the dispatcher that will show in logs
      port - The port on the local machine where the socket will be bound and listen
      Throws:
      SocketException

      public void run()
      Sets up a socket connection using either defaults or the provided port. Note that destinations should be added BEFORE starting the dispatcher.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

      public void shutdown()
      Initiates shutdown process that will lead to the eventual termination of this runnable.

    • subscribe

      public void subscribe(String topic, DispatchConsumer subscriber)
      Subscribes a dispatcher to a topic
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic to which this subscription applies. It doesn't need to be unique so multiple could receive the data if subscribed to the same topic
      subscriber - The DispatchConsumer that will be called when a message arrives with a subscribed topic

    • unSubscribe

      public void unSubscribe(String topic, DispatchConsumer subscriber)
      Removes a subscribers subscriptions for a given topic. This method does not offer any indication if the subscription existed prior to the call.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic that will trigger a dispatch to the DispatchConsumer
      subscriber - The DispatchConsumer to be called when the topic has been received

    • connectNewDestination

      public void connectNewDestination(Destinations destinationEnum, String addr, int port) throws UnknownHostException, UnregisteredDispatcherDestination
      Registers a with the dispatcher by communicating and verifying the destination. This is a synchronous call and will block the calling thread until the new destination is resolved or has failed. The destination will only be registered if it is successful. Otherwise an error is thrown.
      Parameters:
      destinationEnum - The destination identifier. This must be unique. If it already exists it will have its details overwritten.
      addr - The address targeted by messages sent to this destination
      port - The port targeted by messages sent to this destination
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException
      UnregisteredDispatcherDestination

    • handleConnectTopicMessage

      private void handleConnectTopicMessage(DispatcherConnectRequest request, InetAddress requestAddr, int requestPort)

    • registerDestination

      public <T extends Enum<?>> void registerDestination(T destinationEnum, String addr, int port) throws UnknownHostException
      Registers a destination to the Dispatcher. Ideally do this before the Dispatcher has been started for best results. Destinations are used by DispatchConsumers and uniquely identify the target of a message. If the destination already exists it will be overwritten with the new destination address and port for future messages.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The Enumeration subtype that is used to identify the destination
      Parameters:
      destinationEnum - The destination identifier. This must be unique. If it already exists it will have its details overwritten.
      addr - The address targeted by messages sent to this destination
      port - The port targeted by messages sent to this destination
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - If a destination address cannot be resolved

    • getDestination

      private <E extends Enum<?>> HashSet<InetSocketAddress> getDestination(E destination)
      Gets a destination from the mappings in a thread safe manner and then releases the lock
      Type Parameters:
      E - The enum type of the destination
      Parameters:
      destination - The destination identifier that has previously been registered
      Returns:
      The destination found or null if it was not found

    • sendData

      public <E extends Enum<?>, T> void sendData(E destination, T data) throws UnregisteredDispatcherDestination
      Sends data without a topic to an established destination registered to the dispatcher. This method handles all the data conversion.
      Type Parameters:
      E - The destination enum type used to identify a registered to the destination.
      T - The type of the data to be sent
      Parameters:
      destination - The destination enum identifying the message target that's registered to the dispatcher.
      data - The data to be sent
      Throws:
      UnregisteredDispatcherDestination - If the destination provided is not registered to this dispatcher

    • sendData

      public <E extends Enum<?>> void sendData(E destination, String topic) throws UnregisteredDispatcherDestination
      Sends data with a specific topic without any associated data to an established destination registered to the dispatcher.
      Type Parameters:
      E - The destination enum type used to identify a registered to the destination.
      Parameters:
      destination - The destination enum identifying the message target that's registered to the dispatcher.
      topic - The topic used to identify the message, its data, and data type to the receiving system
      Throws:
      UnregisteredDispatcherDestination - If the destination provided is not registered to this dispatcher

    • sendData

      public <E extends Enum<?>, T> void sendData(E destination, String topic, T data) throws UnregisteredDispatcherDestination
      Sends data with a specific topic to an established destination registered to the dispatcher. This method handles all the data conversion.
      Type Parameters:
      E - The destination enum type used to identify a registered to the destination.
      T - The type of the data to be sent
      Parameters:
      destination - destination The destination enum identifying the message target that's registered to the dispatcher.
      topic - The topic used to identify the message, its data, and data type to the receiving system
      data - The data to be sent
      Throws:
      UnregisteredDispatcherDestination - If the destination provided is not registered to this dispatcher

    • sendData

      public <E extends Enum<?>, T> void sendData(E destination, String topic, T data, HashSet<InetSocketAddress> destAddr)
      Sends data with a specific topic to an established destination registered to the dispatcher. This method handles all the data conversion.
      Type Parameters:
      E - The destination enum type used to identify a registered to the destination.
      T - The type of the data to be sent
      Parameters:
      destination - destination The destination enum identifying the message target that's registered to the dispatcher.
      topic - The topic used to identify the message, its data, and data type to the receiving system
      data - The data to be sent
      destAddr - The address where the message should be sent

    • receiveData

      private DispatcherMessage receiveData()
      Receives data from the DatagramSocket and converts it into a DispatcherMessage
      Returns:
      The dispatcher message received from the socket

    • getDispatchList

      private HashSet<DispatchConsumer> getDispatchList(String topic)
      Retrieves all subscribers of a topic in a thread safe manner. Separated so that lock is released before list processing starts.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic to query for subscribers
      Returns:
      A list of DispatchConsumers subscribed to the topic. Will return an empty list if none are subscribed.

    • dispatchMessageToSubscribers

      private void dispatchMessageToSubscribers(DispatcherMessage msg)
      Sends Message to all subscribers of a topic specified in DispatcherMessage
      Parameters:
      msg - The DispatcherMessage containing a topic and data.
